EnablingAuthority.XRefExternal: PROCEEDS OF CRIME (MONEY LAUNDERING) AND TERRORIST FINANCING ACT

Identification.LongTitle: Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Suspicious Transaction Reporting Regulations

Provision.Text: Whereas, pursuant to subsection 73(2) of the Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) Acta, a copy of the proposed Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) Suspicious Transaction Reporting Regulations was published, substantially in the form set out in the annexed Regulations, as part of the Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) Regulations, 2000 in the Canada Gazette, Part I, on February 17, 2001 and a reasonable opportunity was thereby given to interested persons to make representations to the Minister of Finance with respect to the proposed Regulations;

Therefore, Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Finance, pursuant to section 73 of the Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) Acta, hereby makes the annexed Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) Suspicious Transaction Reporting Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: accountant means a chartered accountant, a certified general accountant or a certified management accountant. (comptable)

accounting firm means an entity that is engaged in the business of providing accounting services to the public and has at least one partner, employee or administrator that is an accountant. (cabinet d’expertise comptable)
Act means the Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act. (Loi)

British Columbia notary corporation means an entity that carries on the business of providing notary services to the public in the province of British Columbia in accordance with the Notaries Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 334. (société de notaires de la Colombie-Britannique)
British Columbia notary public means a person who is a member of the Society of Notaries Public of British Columbia. (notaire public de la Colombie-Britannique)

cash means coins referred to in section 7 of the Currency Act, notes issued by the Bank of Canada pursuant to the Bank of Canada Act that are intended for circulation in Canada and coins or bank notes of countries other than Canada. (espèces)
cash or currency[Repealed, SOR/2002-185, s. 2]
casino means a government, organization, board or operator that is referred to in any of paragraphs 5(k) to (k.3) of the Act. (casino)
CICA Handbook means the handbook prepared and published by the Canadian Institute of Chartered Accountants, as amended from time to time. (Manuel de l’ICCA)

credit union central means a central cooperative credit society, as defined in section 2 of the Cooperative Credit Associations Act, or a credit union central or a federation of credit unions or caisses populaires that is regulated by a provincial Act other than one enacted by the legislature of Quebec. (centrale de caisses de crédit)

dealer in precious metals and stones means a person or entity that, in the course of their business activities, buys or sells precious metals, precious stones or jewellery. It includes a department or agent or mandatary of Her Majesty in right of Canada or of a province when the department or agent or mandatary is carrying out the activity, referred to in section 5, of selling precious metals to the public. (négociant en métaux précieux et pierres précieuses)

electronic funds transfer means the transmission — through any electronic, magnetic or optical device, telephone instrument or computer — of instructions for the transfer of funds, other than the transfer of funds within Canada. In the case of SWIFT messages, only SWIFT MT 103 messages are included. (télévirement)

financial entity means a bank that is regulated by the Bank Act, an authorized foreign bank, as defined in section 2 of that Act, in respect of its business in Canada, a cooperative credit society, savings and credit union or caisse populaire that is regulated by a provincial Act, an association that is regulated by the Cooperative Credit Associations Act, a financial services cooperative, a credit union central, a company that is regulated by the Trust and Loan Companies Act and a trust company or loan company that is regulated by a provincial Act. It includes a department or an entity that is an agent or mandatary of Her Majesty in right of Canada or of a province when it is carrying out an activity referred to in paragraph 8(a). (entité financière)

financial services cooperative means a financial services cooperative that is regulated by An Act respecting financial services cooperatives, CQLR, c. C-67.3, or An Act respecting the Mouvement Desjardins, S.Q. 2000, c. 77, other than a caisse populaire. (coopérative de services financiers)
funds means either

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: cash; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: currency, securities, negotiable instruments or other financial instruments, in any form, that indicate a person’s or entity’s title or right to, or interest in, them. (fonds)

Definition.Text: jewellery means objects that are made of gold, silver, palladium, platinum, pearls or precious stones and that are intended to be worn as a personal adornment. (bijou)

life insurance broker or agent means a person or entity that is registered or licensed under provincial legislation to carry on the business of arranging contracts of life insurance. (représentant d’assurance-vie)
listed person has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Regulations Implementing the United Nations Resolutions on the Suppression of Terrorism. (personne inscrite)
precious metal means gold, silver, palladium or platinum in the form of coins, bars, ingots or granules or in any other similar form. (métal précieux)
precious stones means diamonds, sapphires, emeralds, tanzanite, rubies or alexandrite. (pierre précieuse)

real estate broker or sales representative means a person or entity that is registered or licensed under provincial legislation in respect of the sale or purchase of real estate. (courtier ou agent immobilier)

real estate developer means, on any given day in a calendar year, a person or entity who, in that calendar year and before that day or in any previous calendar year after 2007, has sold to the public, other than in the capacity of a real estate broker or sales representative,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: five or more new houses or condominium units;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: one or more new commercial or industrial buildings; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: one or more new multi-unit residential buildings each of which contains five or more residential units, or two or more new multi-unit residential buildings that together contain five or more residential units. (promoteur immobilier)

Definition.Text: SWIFT means the Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication. (SWIFT)
trust company means a company to which the Trust and Loan Companies Act applies or a trust company regulated by a provincial Act. (société de fiducie)

Section.Text: If a registered charity, as defined in subsection 248(1) of the Income Tax Act, conducts and manages, in a permanent establishment of a casino, a lottery scheme that includes games of roulette or card games for a period of not more than two consecutive days at a time and, in doing so, acts under the supervision of the government of a province that is referred to in paragraph 5(k) of the Act, or of an organization that is referred to in paragraph 5(k.2) of the Act, that conducts and manages such a lottery scheme in the same establishment, the lottery scheme that is conducted and managed by the registered charity is considered to be conducted and managed by the supervising government or organization.
The prescribed precious metals for the purpose of paragraph 5(l) of the Act are precious metals as defined in subsection 1(2).

For the purposes of these Regulations, a person acting on behalf of their employer is considered to be acting on behalf of a third party except when the person is depositing cash into the employer’s business account.

Heading.TitleText: Application of Part 1 of the Act

Subsection.Text: Part 1 of the Act applies to financial services cooperatives.
Every credit union central is subject to Part 1 of the Act when it offers financial services to a person or entity other than a financial entity that is a member of that credit union central.

Section.Text: Part 1 of the Act applies to life insurance brokers or agents.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), every British Columbia notary public and every British Columbia notary corporation is subject to Part 1 of the Act when they engage in any of the following activities on behalf of any person or entity, including the giving of instructions on behalf of any person or entity in respect of those activities:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: receiving or paying funds, other than those received or paid in respect of professional fees, disbursements, expenses or bail;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: purchasing or selling securities, real estate or business assets or entities; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: transferring funds or securities by any means.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a British Columbia notary public when they engage in any of the activities referred to in that subsection on behalf of their employer.

Section.Text: Every dealer in precious metals and stones that engages in the purchase or sale of precious metals, precious stones or jewellery in an amount of $10,000 or more in a single transaction, other than such a purchase or sale that is carried out in the course of, in connection with or for the purpose of manufacturing jewellery, extracting precious metals or precious stones from a mine or polishing or cutting precious stones, is subject to Part 1 of the Act.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), every accountant and every accounting firm is subject to Part 1 of the Act when they

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: engage in any of the following activities on behalf of any person or entity, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: receiving or paying funds,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: purchasing or selling securities, real property or business assets or entities, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: transferring funds or securities by any means; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: give instructions on behalf of any person or entity in respect of any activity referred to in paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of an accountant when they engage in any of the activities referred to in paragraph (1)(a) or (b) on behalf of their employer.
For greater certainty, subsection (1) does not apply in respect of audit, review or compilation engagements carried out in accordance with the recommendations set out in the CICA Handbook.

Section.Text: Every real estate broker or sales representative is subject to Part 1 of the Act when they act as an agent in respect of the purchase or sale of real estate.

Subsection.Text: Every real estate developer is subject to Part 1 of the Act when

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a person or of an entity other than a corporation, they sell to the public a new house, a new condominium unit, a new commercial or industrial building or a new multi-unit residential building; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an entity that is a corporation, they sell to the public a new house, a new condominium unit, a new commercial or industrial building or a new multi-unit residential building on their own behalf or on behalf of a subsidiary or affiliate.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), an entity is affiliated with another entity if one of them is wholly owned by the other, if both are wholly owned by the same entity or if their financial statements are consolidated.

Section.Text: Every department and agent or mandatary of Her Majesty in right of Canada or of a province is subject to Part 1 of the Act when, in the course of providing financial services to the public, the department or agent or mandatary

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: accepts deposit liabilities; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sells or redeems money orders.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 11, a report made under section 7 of the Act concerning a financial transaction or attempted financial transaction in respect of which there are reasonable grounds to suspect that the transaction or attempted transaction is related to the commission of a money laundering offence or terrorist activity financing offence shall contain the information set out in Schedule 1.

The person or entity shall send the report to the Centre as soon as practicable after they have taken measures that enable them to establish that there are reasonable grounds to suspect that the transaction or attempted transaction is related to the commission of a money laundering offence or a terrorist activity financing offence.

Heading.TitleText: Report Made Under Section 83.1 of the Criminal Code or Under Section 8 of the Regulations Implementing the United Nations Resolutions on the Suppression of Terrorism

Section.Text: Subject to section 11, a report made under section 7.1 of the Act shall be sent without delay to the Centre and shall contain the information set out in Schedule 2.

Subsection.Text: Where a transaction is required to be reported under section 7 or 7.1 of the Act, the requirement to report information set out in Schedule 1 or 2 does not apply to a person or entity in respect of information set out in an item of that Schedule that is not marked with an asterisk if, after taking reasonable measures to do so, the person or entity is unable to obtain the information.

Despite subsection (1), in the case of an attempted transaction, the requirement to report information set out in Schedule 1 does not apply to a person or entity in respect of information set out in an item of that Schedule that is marked with an asterisk if, after taking reasonable measures to do so, the person or entity is unable to obtain the information.

The report referred to in section 9 shall be sent electronically in accordance with guidelines for report submissions that are prepared by the Centre if the sender has the technical capabilities to do so.

The report referred to in section 9 shall be sent in paper format in accordance with guidelines for report submissions that are prepared by the Centre if the sender does not have the technical capabilities to send the report electronically.
The report referred to in section 10 shall be sent in paper format in accordance with guidelines for report submissions that are prepared by the Centre.

Heading.TitleText: Suspicious Transaction or Attempted Transaction Report

Section.Text: Every person or entity who submits to the Centre a Suspicious Transaction or Attempted Transaction Report set out in Schedule 1 shall keep a copy of the report.
The copy referred to in section 12.1 may be kept in a machine-readable form or in an electronic form, if a paper copy can be readily produced from it.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), every person or entity that is required by section 12.1 to keep a copy of the report referred to in that section shall retain that copy for a period of at least five years following the day on which the report was made.

Where the copy that is required by section 12.1 to be kept by a person is the property of their employer or a person or entity with which they are in a contractual relationship, they are not required to retain the copy after their employment or that contractual relationship ends.

Section.Text: The information that is prescribed as designated information for the purposes of paragraphs 55(7)(f), 55.1(3)(f) and 56.1(5)(f) of the Act is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the following information concerning the person or entity that is involved in the transaction, attempted transaction, importation or exportation or a person or entity acting on their behalf:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: their address, telephone number and email address,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a person, their alias, date of birth and citizenship,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a person, the number of an identification document issued to them by the federal government or a provincial government or by a foreign government that is not a municipal government, other than a document that contains their social insurance number, the issuing authority and, if available, the jurisdiction and country of issue and expiry date of the identification document,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an entity that is involved in the transaction, attempted transaction, importation or exportation, the date of its registration or incorporation, its registration or incorporation number and the jurisdiction and country of issue of that number,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of any person or entity on whose behalf the financial transaction or attempted financial transaction is conducted or on whose behalf the importation or exportation is carried out, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the telephone number of the place of business where the financial transaction or attempted financial transaction occurred;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a financial transaction or an attempted financial transaction, the following information, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the transit and account numbers,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the full name of every account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the transaction number, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the time of the transaction,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of transaction,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the names of the parties to the transaction,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of account,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of all persons authorized to act in respect of the account, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of report, as listed in paragraph 54(a) of the Act, from which the information disclosed is compiled; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an importation or exportation of currency or monetary instruments, the country from which they are being imported or the country to which they are being exported.

ScheduleFormHeading.Label: SCHEDULE 1
ScheduleFormHeading.TitleText: Suspicious Transaction or Attempted Transaction Report

Heading.Label: PART A
Heading.TitleText: Information on Place of Business Where Transaction or Attempted Transaction Occurred

Item.Text: Type of reporting person or entity, as described in paragraphs 5(a) to (h) and (k) to (m) of the Act, and, if reporting person or entity is referred to in paragraph (5)(i) or (j) of the Act, type of business, profession or activity of reporting person or entity, as described in sections 3 to 8 of these Regulations
Identification number of place of business where transaction or attempted transaction occurred (e.g., institution’s identification number, licence number or registration number), if applicable
Full name of reporting person or entity
Full address of place of business where transaction or attempted transaction occurred
Name and telephone number of contact person

Heading.Label: PART B
Heading.TitleText: Information on Transaction or Attempted Transaction

Item.Text: Date of transaction or attempted transaction or night deposit indicator
Time of transaction or attempted transaction
Posting date (if different from above)

Purpose and details of the transaction or attempted transaction, including type of funds, amount of transaction or attempted transaction, currency of transaction or attempted transaction, and, if applicable, name and number of each other institution and name and account number of each other person or entity

Disposition of funds, amount of disposition, currency of disposition, and, if applicable, name and number of each other institution and name, account number and policy number of each other person or entity
Method by which the transaction was conducted or attempted (in branch or office, ABM, armoured car, mail deposit, courier, telephone or other)
Whether the transaction has been completed or not
If transaction not completed, the reason why it was not completed
Account number
Branch number or transit number
Type of account (personal, business, trust or other)
Full name of each account holder
Type of currency of the account
Date account opened
Date account closed, if applicable
Status of account (active, inactive or dormant)

Heading.Label: PART D
Heading.TitleText: Information on Person Conducting or Attempting To Conduct Transaction

Item.Text: Person’s full name
Client number provided by reporting person or entity, if applicable
Person’s full address
Person’s country of residence
Person’s personal telephone number
Person’s citizenship
Type of document or other information used to identify person and number of document or number associated with information
Jurisdiction and country of issue of document or other information used to identify person
Person’s date of birth
Person’s occupation
Person’s business telephone number
Person’s employer
Employer’s full business address
Employer’s business telephone number

Heading.Label: PART E
Heading.TitleText: Information on Entity on Whose Behalf Transaction Is Conducted or Attempted (if applicable)

Item.Text: Entity’s full name
Full name of each person — up to three — who is authorized to bind the entity or act with respect to the account
Entity’s type of business
Entity’s full address
Entity’s telephone number
Entity’s incorporation number and place of issue, if applicable

Heading.Label: PART F
Heading.TitleText: Information on Person on Whose Behalf Transaction Is Conducted or Attempted (if applicable)

Item.Text: Person’s full name
Person’s full address
Person’s personal telephone number
Person’s business telephone number
Person’s citizenship
Type of document or other information used to identify person and number of document or number associated with information
Jurisdiction and country of issue of document or other information used to identify person
Person’s date of birth
Person’s country of residence
Person’s occupation
Person’s employer
Employer’s full business address
Employer’s business telephone number
Relationship of person conducting the transaction or attempted transaction to the person on whose behalf the transaction or attempted transaction is conducted
Detailed description of the grounds to suspect that the transaction or attempted transaction is related to the commission of a money laundering offence or terrorist activity financing offence
Any other action taken as a result of suspicion

ScheduleFormHeading.Label: SCHEDULE 2
ScheduleFormHeading.TitleText: Terrorist Group or Listed Person Property Report

Heading.Label: PART A
Heading.TitleText: Information on the Person or Entity Filing this Report

Item.Text: Type of reporting person or entity
Reporting person or entity’s identifier number (if applicable)
Full name of reporting person or entity
Full address of reporting person or entity
Name and telephone number of contact person
Reason for filing the report
How the reporting person or entity came to know that the property in question is owned or controlled by or on behalf of a terrorist group or listed person
Full name of that terrorist group or listed person
Full address of that terrorist group or listed person
Phone number of that terrorist group or listed person
Full name of person or entity that owns or controls the property on behalf of the terrorist group or listed person (if applicable)
Full address of that person or entity
Phone number of that person or entity
Type of property
Type of property identifier
Property identifier number
Approximate or actual value of property
Description of property
Account number
Branch or transit number
Type of account (personal, business, trust or other)
Type of currency of the account
Full name of each account holder
Date account opened
Date account closed, if applicable
Status of account (active, inactive or dormant)

Heading.Label: PART E
Heading.TitleText: Information on the Transaction or Proposed Transaction (if applicable)

Item.Text: Date of transaction or night deposit indicator
Time of transaction
Posting date (if different from above)

Purpose and details of the transaction, including type of funds or assets involved, amount of transaction, currency of transaction, and, if applicable, name and number of each other institution and name and account number of each other person or entity

Disposition of funds, amount of disposition, currency of disposition, and, if applicable, name and number of each other institution and name, account number and policy number of each other person or entity
Method by which the transaction is conducted or proposed to be conducted (in branch or office, ABM, armoured car, mail deposit, courier, telephone or other)

Heading.Label: PART F
Heading.TitleText: Information on Person Conducting or Proposing To Conduct the Transaction (if applicable)

Item.Text: Person’s full name
Person’s alias, if any
Client number provided by reporting person or entity, if applicable
Person’s full address
Person’s country of residence
Person’s citizenship
Person’s personal telephone number
Type of document or other information used to identify person and number of document or number associated with information
Jurisdiction and country of issue of document or other information used to identify person
Person’s date of birth
Person’s occupation
Person’s business telephone number
Person’s employer
Employer’s full business address
Employer’s business phone number

Heading.Label: PART G
Heading.TitleText: Information on Entity on Whose Behalf the Transaction Is Conducted or Proposed To Be Conducted (if applicable)

Item.Text: Full name of entity
Full name of each person — up to three — who is authorized to bind the entity or act with respect to the account
Full address of entity
Telephone number of entity
Incorporation number and place of issue, if applicable
Entity’s type of business

Heading.Label: PART H
Heading.TitleText: Information on Person on Whose Behalf Transaction Is Conducted or Proposed To Be Conducted (if applicable)

Item.Text: Person’s full name
Person’s alias, if any
Person’s full address
Person’s personal telephone number
Person’s business telephone number
Type of document or other information used to identify person and number of document or number associated with information
Jurisdiction and country of issue of document or other information used to identify person
Person’s date of birth
Person’s country of residence
Person’s citizenship
Person’s occupation
Person’s employer
Employer’s full business address
Employer’s business telephone number
Relationship of person conducting or proposing to conduct the transaction to the person on whose behalf the transaction is conducted

Heading.TitleText: — SOR/2019-240, s. 1, as amended by SOR/2020-112, s. 1

Subsection.Text: The definitions accountant, accounting firm, British Columbia notary corporation, British Columbia notary public, CICA Handbook, credit union central, dealer in precious metals and stones, electronic funds transfer, financial entity, financial services cooperative, jewellery, life insurance broker or agent, precious metal, precious stones, real estate broker or sales representative, real estate developer, SWIFT and trust company in subsection 1(2) of the Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Suspicious Transaction Reporting Regulations1 are repealed.
The definition funds in subsection 1(2) of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Definition.Text: funds means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: cash and other fiat currencies, and securities, negotiable instruments or other financial instruments that indicate a title or right to or interest in them; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a private key of a cryptographic system that enables a person or entity to have access to a fiat currency other than cash.

ContinuedDefinition.Text: For greater certainty, it does not include virtual currency. (fonds)

Subsection.Text: The definition cash in subsection 1(2) of the English version of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Definition.Text: cash means coins referred to in section 7 of the Currency Act, notes issued by the Bank of Canada under the Bank of Canada Act that are intended for circulation in Canada or coins or bank notes of countries other than Canada. (espèces)

Subsection.Text: Subsection 1(2) of the Regulations is amended by adding the following in alphabetical order:

Definition.Text: fiat currency means a currency that is issued by a country and is designated as legal tender in that country. (monnaie fiduciaire)
virtual currency means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a digital representation of value that can be used for payment or investment purposes that is not a fiat currency and that can be readily exchanged for funds or for another virtual currency that can be readily exchanged for funds; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a private key of a cryptographic system that enables a person or entity to have access to a digital representation of value referred to in paragraph (a). (monnaie virtuelle)

Section.Text: Sections 1.2 to 8 of the Regulations are replaced by the following:

Heading.TitleText: Report Under Section 7 of the Act

Section.Text: The heading before section 10 and sections 10 to 12.3 of the Regulations are replaced by the following:

Heading.TitleText: Report Under Section 7.1 of the Act

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 11, a report made under section 7.1 of the Act shall contain the information set out in Schedule 2.
The person or entity shall send the report to the Centre immediately.

The requirement to report information set out in Schedule 1 or 2 does not apply in respect of information set out in an item of that Schedule that is not marked with an asterisk if, after taking reasonable measures to do so, the person or entity is unable to obtain the information.

In the case of an attempted transaction, the requirement to report information set out in Schedule 1 does not apply in respect of information set out in an item of that Schedule that is marked with an asterisk if, after taking reasonable measures to do so, the person or entity is unable to obtain the information.

The requirement to report information set out in Schedule 1 or 2 does not apply if the person or entity believes that taking the reasonable measures to obtain the information would inform a person or entity that conducts or attempts or proposes to conduct a transaction with them that the transaction and related information will be reported under section 7 or 7.1 of the Act.
For greater certainty, although items in Schedules 1 and 2 are described in the singular, a person or entity shall report all known information that falls within an item.
For greater certainty, a person or entity is not required to report information set out in any item of Schedule 1 or 2 that is not applicable in the circumstances.

Section.Text: A report shall be sent electronically in accordance with guidelines that are prepared by the Centre, if the sender has the technical capabilities to do so. If the sender does not have the technical capabilities to send the report electronically, the report shall be sent in paper format in accordance with guidelines that are prepared by the Centre.

Subsection.Text: A person or entity that sends a report to the Centre shall keep a copy of the report for a period of at least five years after the day on which the report is sent.
The copy of the report may be kept in a machine-readable or electronic form if a paper copy can be readily produced from it.

For greater certainty, if the copy is the property of a person’s employer or of a person or entity with which the person is in a contractual relationship, the person is not required to keep it after the end of their employment or the contractual relationship.

Section.Text: The heading before section 13 of the English version of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Subsection.Text: The portion of paragraph 13(b) of the English version of the Regulations before subparagraph (i) is replaced by the following:

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a financial transaction or attempted financial transaction, the following information:

Subsection.Text: Subparagraphs 13(b)(i) to (iii) of the Regulations are replaced by the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: every account number and transit number that is involved,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of the transaction or attempted transaction and every other reference number that is connected to the transaction or attempted transaction,

Subsection.Text: Subparagraphs 13(b)(iv) to (vi) of the English version of the Regulations are replaced by the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the time of the transaction or attempted transaction,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of transaction or attempted transaction,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the names of the parties to the transaction or attempted transaction,

Subsection.Text: Subparagraphs 13(b)(viii) and (ix) of the Regulations are replaced by the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of each person who is authorized to act in respect of the account, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of report, as listed in paragraph 54(1)(a) of the Act, from which the information disclosed is compiled; and

Subsection.Text: Paragraph 13(c) of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an importation or exportation of fiat currency or monetary instruments, the country from which they are being imported or the country to which they are being exported.

Section.Text: Schedule 1 to the Regulations is amended by replacing the references after the heading “SCHEDULE 1” with the following:
Part A of Schedule 1 to the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Heading.Label: PART A
Heading.TitleText: Information with Respect to Reporting Person or Entity and Place of Business Where Transaction Is Conducted or Attempted

Item.Text: Person’s or entity’s name

Type of person or entity, as described in any of paragraphs 5(a) to (h.1), (k) and (m) of the Act, or, if person or entity is referred to in paragraph 5(i), (j) or (l) of the Act, type of prescribed business, profession or activity referred to in that paragraph
Identification number assigned to person or entity by Centre
Number that identifies place of business
Address of place of business
Contact person’s name
Contact person’s email address
Contact person’s telephone number

Section.Text: The heading of Part B of Schedule 1 to the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Heading.TitleText: Information with Respect to Transaction or Attempted Transaction

Section.Text: Items 3 to 9 of Part B of Schedule 1 to the Regulations are replaced by the following:

Item.Text: Posting date, if different from date of transaction or attempted transaction
Type and amount of funds or other assets involved, other than virtual currency
Type and amount of each fiat currency or virtual currency involved
Method by which transaction or attempted transaction conducted
Exchange rates used
In the case of transaction or attempted transaction involving virtual currency, transaction identifiers, including sending and receiving addresses
Indication of whether transaction completed
If transaction not completed, reason why not completed
Purpose of transaction or attempted transaction
Source of funds or virtual currency involved
Name of every person or entity that is source of funds or virtual currency involved and their account number or policy number or, if no account number or policy number, identifying number
Following details of remittance of, or in exchange for, funds or virtual currency received:

Item.Label: (a)
Item.Text: method of remittance

Item.Label: (b)
Item.Text: if remittance is in funds, type and amount of each type of funds involved

Item.Label: (c)
Item.Text: if remittance is in virtual currency, type and amount of each virtual currency involved

Item.Label: (d)
Item.Text: if remittance is not in funds or virtual currency, type of remittance and its value, if different from amount of funds or virtual currency received

Item.Label: (e)
Item.Text: name of every person or entity involved and their account number or policy number or, if no account number or policy number, identifying number

Section.Text: Parts C to F of Schedule 1 to the Regulations are replaced by the following:

Item.Text: Every account number and other equivalent reference number connected to transaction or attempted transaction
Type of account
Branch number, institution number and similar numbers connected to account or reference number
Name of each account holder
Type of fiat currency or virtual currency of account
Date account opened
Date account closed
Status of account

Person’s or entity’s address

Internet Protocol address used by device
Person’s or entity’s user name

Section.Text: Item 1 of Part G of Schedule 1 to the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Item.Text: Detailed description of grounds to suspect that transaction or attempted transaction is related to commission or attempted commission of money laundering offence or terrorist activity financing offence

Section.Text: The heading of Part H to Schedule 1 to the Regulations is replaced by the following:
Schedule 2 to the Regulations is amended by replacing the references after the heading “SCHEDULE 2” with the following:
Part A of Schedule 2 to the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Heading.Label: PART A
Heading.TitleText: Information With Respect to Reporting Person or Entity and Place of Business Where Transaction Is Conducted or Proposed To Be Conducted

Item.Text: Person’s or entity’s name

Type of person or entity, as described in any of paragraphs 5(a) to (h.1) and (k) of the Act, or, if person or entity is referred to in paragraph 5(i), (j) or (l) of the Act, type of prescribed business, profession or activity referred to in that paragraph
Identification number assigned to person or entity by Centre
Number that identifies place of business
Address of place of business
Contact person’s name
Contact person’s email address
Contact person’s telephone number

Section.Text: The heading of Part B of Schedule 2 to the English version of the Regulations is replaced by the following:
Item 1 of Part B of Schedule 2 to the English version of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Item.Text: Reason for filing report

Section.Text: Items 2 to 8 of Part B of Schedule 2 to the Regulations are replaced by the following:

Item.Text: Indication of how reporting person or entity came to know that property in question owned or controlled by or on behalf of terrorist group or listed person

Telephone number of terrorist group or listed person
Name of person or entity that owns or controls the property on behalf of terrorist group or listed person
Person’s or entity’s address
Person’s or entity’s email address
Person’s or entity’s telephone number
Person’s or entity’s URL

Section.Text: The heading of Part C of Schedule 2 to the Regulations is replaced by the following:
Items 2 and 3 of Part C of Schedule 2 to the Regulations are replaced by the following:

Item.Text: Means used to identify property and every number of, or associated with, that property

Section.Text: Parts D to H of Schedule 2 to the Regulations are replaced by the following:

Item.Label: (e)
Item.Text: name of every person or entity involved and their account number or policy number or, if no account number or policy number, identifying number
